summary: The 'Cutting Paperwork for Taxpayers Act' aims to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The bill proposes to exclude from gross income any interest earned on tax overpayments for individuals and small businesses. This change applies to taxable years beginning after the bill's enactment. It modifies the tax code by adding a new section (139J) related to interest on overpayments and updates the table of contents accordingly.
